intro: Lophalix coccinea, commonly known as the red-flowered lophalix, is a striking plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Lophalidiaceae, characterized by its vibrant red petals and unique floral structure. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its flowers are known for their intricate patterns and are often visited by specific pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. Due to its rarity and ecological significance, Lophalix coccinea is considered a species of conservation concern.
